intro: Boechera yorkii, commonly known as York's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Boechera yorkii typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or arid environments. It is a perennial plant that is well adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
